intro: Eriospermum brevipes, commonly known as the narrowleaf eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its small, narrow leaves are adapted to reduce water loss, and it produces yellow flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. The species is noted for its resilience and is sometimes cultivated for ornamental purposes.
